comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: Leader of the British suffragette movement. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmeline_Pankhurst

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Inverted date written on negative is 5/16/12 #2. Pankhurst was sentenced (in London) to nine months jail on May 22, 1912 "convicted of conspiracy and incitement to commit damage, the charges arising out of the suffragist window-smashing campaign." See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B02EEDA153CE633A... Photo apparently by Matzene of Chicago. She had been in Chicago in November 1909, according to NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9400E6D81630E733A... She was there again in November 1913. Matzene appears to have registered a photograph in the same outfit hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3b34110 for copyright as of October 25 1913. Another LoC photo -- hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3b31732 -- is quite specifically a photo from 1909 copyrighted in 1913. So perhaps that's the case for the Matzene photos -- taken during the 1909 visit but copyrighted at the start of her 1913 visit. Pankhurst was held at Ellis Island for a day or two (Oct 18-20, 1913) with a deportation order issued, but later rescinded. Another picture by Matzene, dated as from the 1913 visit and in a different outfit is hdl.loc.gov/loc.mss/mnwp.275016. Pin/brooch and ribbon are probably of some significance.

comment.author: 63418443@N04
comment._content: I am a relative of Emmiline Pankhurst. My grandfather is Edwin Pankhurst. His mother was Sara...I wish to trace our family lineage. Thank you for any support you may send my way. My mother is Theresa Marie Pankhurst and she had six brothers. Michael is the only living brother my mother has. Dianne Pauline Bradley
